column4: PRESS DIGEST- New York Times business news - Sept 28

column4: Almost 129 000 VW cars in Switzerland affected by diesel scandal: distributor
column5: ZURICH Almost 129 000 Volkswagen  group vehicles registered in Switzerland are affected by the rigged emissions testing scandal that has halted Swiss sales of new models equipped with the diesel motors in question  VW's Swiss distributor AMAG said.

column4: UPDATE 2-Almost 129 000 VW cars in Switzerland affected by diesel scandal -distributor
column5: ZURICH  Sept 28 Almost 129 000 Volkswagen  group vehicles registered in Switzerland are affected by the rigged emissions testing scandal that has halted Swiss sales of new models equipped with the diesel motors in question  VW's Swiss distributor AMAG said.

column4: Nearly 129 000 VW cars in Switzerland affected by diesel scandal-distributor
column5: ZURICH  Sept 28 Some 128 802 Volkswagen  group cars registered in Switzerland are affected by the diesel manipulation scandal that has halted Swiss sales of new models equipped with the diesel motors in question  Volkswagen's Swiss distributor AMAG said.

column4: Apple reports record sales of iPhone 6s  6s Plus in first weekend

column4: Hon Hai considering buying $1.7 billion stake in Sharp LCD unit: paper
column5: TOKYO Taiwan's Hon Hai Precision Industry Co is considering buying a majority stake in Sharp Corp's loss-making LCD business for up to 200 billion yen ($1.7 billion)  Japan's Mainichi newspaper said on Monday  without citing any sources.

column4: Hon Hai considering buying $1.7 bln stake in Sharp LCD unit-paper
column5: TOKYO  Sept 28 Taiwan's Hon Hai Precision Industry Co is considering buying a majority stake in Sharp Corp's loss-making LCD business for up to 200 billion yen ($1.7 billion)  Japan's Mainichi newspaper said on Monday  without citing any sources.

column4: Autodesk's move to cloud could send up stock: Barron's
column5: NEW YORK Design-software company Autodesk Inc's shares could jump 50 percent in the next 18 months as investors get more comfortable with the company's transition to a cloud-based business model  according to a Sunday report in Barron's financial newspaper.

column4: Comcast buys majority stake in Universal Studios Japan for $1.5 billion

column4: Comcast buys majority stake in Universal Studios Japan for $1.5 billion
column5: OSAKA U.S. cable company Comcast Corp said on Monday it has agreed to acquire a majority stake in Osaka-based Universal Studios Japan for $1.5 billion  part of an acceleration of its  global theme park strategy.

column4: Comcast says to buy 51 pct of Universal Studios Japan for $1.5 bln
column5: OSAKA  Sept 28 U.S. cable company Comcast Corp  said on Monday it has agreed to buy a 51 percent stake in Osaka-based theme park operator USJ Co for $1.5 billion.

column4: Cypress Semiconductor drops bid for chipmaker Atmel
column5: Cypress Semiconductor Corp has withdrawn its offer for Atmel Corp  the second failed attempt by the company to acquire a chipmaker this year.

column5: Sept 28 Cypress Semiconductor Corp has withdrawn its offer for Atmel Corp  the second failed attempt by the company to acquire a chipmaker this year.

column4: Fifth Third settles U.S. auto loan bias  credit card charges
column5: Fifth Third Bancorp will pay $21.5 million to settle U.S. charges that it discriminated against black and Hispanic borrowers on auto loans  and deceived credit card customers into paying excess fees  authorities announced on Monday.

column4: U.S. settles insider trading charges tied to Gilead acquisition
column5: WASHINGTON Five Florida residents including two attorneys and an accountant will collectively pay about $489 000 to settle civil charges over insider-trading ahead of Gilead Science's acquisition of Pharmasset  U.S. regulators said Monday.

column4: JetBlue expands U.S.-Cuba service ahead of expected travel opening
column5: HAVANA JetBlue will add a second charter flight from New York's John F. Kennedy airport to Havana  expanding charter service ahead of an expected opening of commercial air travel between the two countries  the company said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-JetBlue expands U.S.-Cuba service ahead of expected travel opening
column5: HAVANA/WASHINGTON  Sept 28 JetBlue Airways Corp  will add a second charter flight from New York's John F. Kennedy airport to Havana  expanding charter service ahead of an expected opening of commercial air travel between the two countries  the company said on Monday.

column4: JetBlue expands U.S.-Cuba service ahead of expected travel opening
column5: HAVANA  Sept 28 U.S. airline JetBlue  will add a second charter flight from New York's John F. Kennedy airport to Havana  expanding charter service ahead of an expected opening of commercial air travel between the two countries  the company said on Monday.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 3-Vodafone and Liberty Global end European tie-up talks
column5: LONDON  Sept 28 Vodafone and Liberty Global have abandoned  talks about a swap of business assets in Europe's converging mobile phone  broadband and TV markets  they said on Monday  having failed to agree on valuations.

column4: European shares dip as VW and Vodafone lose ground
column5: LONDON  Sept 28 European shares dipped lower on Monday  although Vodafone lagged after ending talks with Liberty Global and carmaker Volkswagen  which has been hit by an emissions data scandal  also declined.

column4: Vodafone  Liberty talks broke down on asset values: source
column5: LONDON Talks between Vodafone and Liberty Global collapsed because the two companies could not agree on the valuation of assets on either side  but the door has not closed on potential future discussions  according to a person close to the talks.

column4: European shares slip  Vodafone lags
column5: LONDON  Sept 28 European shares slipped on Monday  with Vodafone lagging after ending talks with Liberty Global while Spanish shares tracked other markets after separatists won a majority of seats in an election in Catalonia.

column4: European Factors to Watch-Futures fall  Spain in focus after Catalan result
column5: (Adds futures prices  company news items)     LONDON  Sept 28 European equity futures fell on Monday  tracking a similar decline on Asian markets  while Spanish shares could come into focus after separatists won a clear majority of seats in Catalonia's parliament in an election.     Futures for the euro zone's blue-chip Euro STOXX 50  Germany's DAX  and France's CAC were all down by around 1 percent  while futures on Britain's FTSE 100 fell 0.5 percent. column4: UPDATE 5-Energy Transfer to buy Williams for $33 bln after long quest

column4: After calamitous year for coal  U.S. consumers hold key for rails
column5: CHICAGO/NEW YORK Investors in U.S. railroad stocks  who have been punished in 2015 by an accelerating decline in high-margin coal shipments  now are pinning their long-term hopes on a resurgence in consumer spending.

column4: Brazil's Vale cuts dividend in face of iron ore rout
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Sept 28 Brazil's Vale SA  said on Monday it plans to cut its dividend for the year by $500 million in order to help shore up the miner's balance sheet in the face of weaker commodity prices  especially iron ore.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. House Democrats slam Valeant's drug price hikes; shares sink
column5: Sept 28 Democratic lawmakers on Monday attacked "massive" price increases of two heart drugs from Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  fueling a rout in drugmaker shares on worries of a government and insurer clampdown on U.S. drug prices.

column4: U.S. House Democrats take aim at price hikes for Valeant drugs; shares drop
column5: Sept 28 All 18 Democratic members of a U.S. House of Representatives committee on Monday urged their chairman to subpoena Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc to force it to provide documents related to "massive" price increases for two of its heart drugs.
